document_data.mainbody:
lame heather was a rare plant found only in the mountains of the Nakvaligach region of the Great Glacier.
Flame heather grew in clusters of two to four plants, growing to a height of approximately . Its delicate, feather-like leaves were red and yellow.
Flame heather took its name from its exceptional flammability. A single cluster could burn throughout the entire night, delivering ample heat to warm a medium-sized snowhouse.
